result.execSummary:
The defendant Geoffrey R. Lamb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo a psychological evaluation and follow all treatment recommendations.
Pay child support arrears and remain current in child support obligation.

timeConds.notes:
To begin forthwith.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Ct. 2 and Ct. 3

DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Geoffrey R. Lamb in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed - based on waiver court bound DE over for trial. Information filed by the state which mirrors complaint. Agreement placed on the record by Atty. Tlusty. DE entered a plea of no contest to counts 1, 2 and 3. Plea colloquy. Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty on counts 1, 2 and 3, and ordered entry of JOC. Pursuant to the agreement, counts 4 and 5 are dismissed and read in for purposes of sentencing. Brief comments by counsel and defendant. Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for three years with the following conditions: 10 months county jail with huber privileges on each charge concurrent with each other to begin forthwith; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; psychological evaluation and follow all treatment recommendations; pay child support arrears; remain current on child support obligation. 48 days sentence credit applied if revoked. Court orders payment plan of $25.00/month beginning June 1, 2015. ap
